page.title: 02Mentmore Towers
page.content: Sitting in the 'Gold Room' and listening to a piano being played in the background, I was told that Mentmore Towers, built in 1855 for{ {Baron Rothschild}and later occupied by his daughter, is now the headquarters of the{British Seat of the World {Government of the Age of {Enlightenment,}run by a charity organisation. The residents of Mentmore village are able to make free use of the 90 acres of parkland surrounding the Towers and show no concern about the present use of the buildings. To assist with the maintainance and upkeep, film work, TV commercials and private functions bring in an income, as does the annual Craft Fair. An aura of peacefulness prevails as people pass through the beautifully preserved and ornate rooms.
